name: Buttermilk Pancakes
directions: Whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk, eggs, and vanilla.
If you don't have buttermilk, in a measuring cup, combine 1 tablespoon of white vinegar for each cup of milk. Let it sit for 5 minutes before using.
Slowly drizzle in melted butter while whisking until combined.
Pour wet ingredients into dry and stir gently until just combined; small flour streaks are fine.
Preheat a greased nonstick skillet over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes.
Scoop 1/2â€“2/3 cup batter per pancake onto the skillet.
Cook until edges set and bubbles pop, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Repeat with remaining batter, greasing the pan as needed.
